alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 25 at 5:07PM EDT until July 26 at 11:55AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown affecting Chester County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Open adjacent land next to the creek floods. At 8.0 feet, Dowlin Forge Road begins to flood. At 9.0 feet, High water on the Brandywine sends backwater up Beaver Creek. Beaver Creek floods inundating parks and the Downingtown Little League fields. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 7.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 PM EDT Tuesday was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.8 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.6 feet on 04/14/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (5 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date East Branch Bran Downingtown 7.0 7.3 Tue 4 pm 3.1 MSG 9.8 10pm 7/25 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 515 AM EDT.
